website_summaries.verdict: Sounds, songs, and games with Scout the puppy will entertain kids 18 months and up. Parents love how portable it is to bring on the go.
pros: Take advantage of your child's obsession with your smartphone by giving them their own version that teaches counting, cause and effect, and conversation skills
Music button plays songs, and all 10 number buttons get Scout to count it out on the screen
Kids can even trade calls and voicemails with Scout, making it a fun pretend game toy
2 volume settings mean it works in lots of settings
cons: The graphics leave room for improvement, but users still love the toy

customer_reviews.title: Really great phone for older babies. Not for babies teething.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is really great. I really love it. It is not made for teething babies. It states 18+ is the appropriate age for this phone. Totally my fault for not checking out the pic better. I gave it to my 9 month old teething baby and he almost ruined the screen within minutes. It has a very thin plastic screen the can easily be dented by new sharp teeth. It is overall about one inch thick also and has a bit of weight to it. I can't wait to give it back to him when it's older. It has cool like dog graphics and helps them learn to count with visuals and how to answer a phone properly.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy ever and no longer swipes my phone
customer_reviews.text: My two and a half year old daughter was using anything and everything as a "cell phone" so I bought her this for Christmas. She didn't want to open any other presents after she opened it and takes it everywhere. There are two volume settings. The low one is just perfect, not too obnoxious for the adults in the room. I can't comment on the electronic features because she hasn't let me hold it long enough to figure it out!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: A must-have, for little ones! :)
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute learning toy! Little ones LOVE it too! Bought one, for my little girl (when she was around a year old). She’s 7 now and still likes it (she rarely plays with it anymore, but if she comes upon it, while digging thru her toys, she always stops to play with it awhile.) She got years of ‘regular play’ out of it, though.. at least til age 4. Just bought one for my little niece, who turned one and she loves it too! I like the improvements they’ve made, since buying my daughter’s (light up screen, added pink coloring, & a bit more streamlined body). Very cute! A must-have for little ones, in my opinion! :)
customer_reviews.author: KC Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: A Toddlers Dream Cell Phone!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old grandson LOVES this phone. It is a lifesaver for my son and I since he always makes a B-line for our cell phones. It runs on batteries and there are buttons to push to his hearts content. The buttons light up and play music and click on numbers and letters and talks to teach what they are. It also talks to him and says "it is glad he called" Sooooo cute! It seems really sturdy too. The plastic housing is nice and thick so it would survive being thrown across the room on a carpeted floor. Or stepped on by a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter 3 weeks ago to replaced an older model that she lost. The new toy stopped working all of a sudden while she was playing with it in bed. I replaced the generic batteries with brand new Duracell AAA batteries and the device still will not turn on. It’s toast. I don’t have time to return this and wait for a new one. This is my daughter’s favorite toy and I’m just going to have to find one at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Antonio

customer_reviews.title: It works, its sturdy, it appears kid proof
customer_reviews.text: Bought another brand and returned it immediately. Didnt work. Decided to go big time and spend $5 more. prime is on time ...36 hours after ordering this one...it arrived. WOW ! It works, it's sturdy and looks kid proof ! So I have to offer an observation: Lime green is cute but kids want cell phones...black ones...like the other product that didnt work. Still , I'd give this 99 out of 100. If the manufacturer wanted 101 out of 100 they'd paint it black and give it a silicone or bite-able case because that;s what kids do. Bite cellphones. Grandpa pays attention.
customer_reviews.author: eddiekay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: My 17 month old loves this thing. It’s not too loud, which is normally a problem with electronic toys. This one has reasonable volume. The buttons are a nice realistic press. He’s quite pleased with this!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Harrell

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 12 month old LOVES this toy. I did not expect it, but she carries this thing around everywhere :)
customer_reviews.author: S J

customer_reviews.title: Keeps him busy in spurts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14 month old grandson to see if it would deter him from grabbing our cell phones. He does like the toy, but he is still very young and doesn't really understand all it's capabilities. So, he still prefers a wireless or cell phone. But, I think as he gets a little older and communicates better, he will enjoy the features of this toy a bit more. Overall, I'm not unhappy with the purchase. But, I feel it's definitely for the age group it was designed for, which is older than my grandson. :)
customer_reviews.author: ButYouCanCallMeAl

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable toy phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little play phone that my toddler does enjoy. The only thing I have to say that I don't enjoy about it is when she's left it on my bedroom floor and I accidentally step on it in the middle of the night. Resulting in the light blasting my eyes, and the noise going on which leaves me feeling startled. Even worse is that it'll just ring for a little bit to get your attention before giving up. Not exactly the best thing in the middle of the night. ;) Other than the freaky 'mom is tired and this dang toy just went off' it's a great toy and I'm glad she enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Kisa

customer_reviews.title: Can you hear me now?
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my one year old who loves things that light up and make sounds. He seems to enjoy it and has gotten plenty of play out of it in the last 6 months. I expected it to come with more songs and features; it’s very basic in that sense. The battery life on this phone is very long lasting; I haven’t had to change the batteries since purchase. Overall a cute toy, not loud or annoying.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I expect a toy to be educational as well as fun. Too many baby toys are simply noise makers and the noise has little to do with the result or action. An example, other toys when a number is selected, the result could be several different items displayed. How does the baby know how to relate the number to what is displayed? The Leap Frog Chat and Count Smart Phone displays one item in the amount of the number selected. Another example is the phone conversation, it keeps it simple and quick. I like every feature on this phone. It’s fun and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I'll give this item 5 stars. Although it was pretty unmemorable for my son. Sure, any toy only lasts a minute or two with toddlers or younger. He'd pick it up and still seemed interested in other toys more. But it works, it's easy to clean, had enough functions and sounds to not get boring, so overall, we can't complain. I'm sure he's just smart enough to realize it's not a real phone that doesn't have Moana on it so he moves on to his trucks and cars. Either way, great buy, great gift. Just not really our sons cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Clark

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Loves this!!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves this - he's almost 2 and loves pretending to talk to gramma on his own phone. He also loves the little puppy. His favorite button is the "8" ... "Eight bees..." and then the bees chance the puppy, he says 'uh oh' and runs away. So my toddler does the same thing. Pushes the 8... says 'Uh oh' then runs away. SO CUTE. There's 2 volume options, but let's face it when he turns it on, it's always on the loud one. Which isn't loud enough to be obnoxious. This was definitely worth the purchase. And I love that it also teaches him numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Fries

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby, happy flight!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our little one happy on a long plane ride. I made sure she had never seen it before the trip, and then pulled it out once she started getting restless. It completely did the trick! She absolutely loved it so much I had to let her have it for the actual vacation (I had planned on hiding it for the next two weeks and bringing it back for the plane ride home). Unfortunately, she lost it somewhere during that two week vacation but it was completely worth it to have a happy baby, on an 8 hour flight!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Norris

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Teaches numbers. Fun voice and cute songs. Cons: Pretty heavy for a small child and is very wide so it makes it difficult for little hands to hold with one hand and mimic a phone, which is what the child will want to do. The display looks like it is from a 1980’s 2-bit computer.
customer_reviews.author: Humour

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: My little one has been showing an interest in our cell phones so this was the closest option to one and a plus that it’s educational. The buttons are 0-9 like a regular landline phone. There’s a screen that lights up green. I wished it was a bit more updated than this but it makes noise, counts, and plays music. It does it’s job to keep my little one entertained but it is limited to just numbers.
customer_reviews.author: DKN

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if your baby tries to eat your phone! My son loves this so much. It was in his crib (mistake after cleaning) when he was sleeping. I start to hear it sing and think "GREAT possessed toy" and I walk in to see my son playing with it. He realized I'm there and buries his face in the mattress to pretend hes asleep. I died laughing because my kids not even 10 months old yet. Point is: buy this! It's a fun alternative to having lick marks on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honestyik
customer_reviews.text: It was broken, and it was a gift. i got embarrassed in front of my sister in law.
customer_reviews.author: Picky ida

customer_reviews.title: So far this is the best toy cell phone yet!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through two toy cell phones before this one. I liked the price of this one, so that was the determining factor, along with the fact that leap frog has never steered me wrong. This little toy is sturdy and blocky which is great for little baby hands. There aren’t too many songs and the number buttons actually count to that number, which is great! Sometimes simple is better. My 14 month old loves this phone! I also did not realize upon ordering that the screen has little pixelated pictures for each button with is super fun! A smartphone for babies!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: a kid's dream phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought My two Grandchildren one of each color of these Smart phones, for the Holidays. they sure were excited to open them and see them. they enjoyed playing with them. the question above, I am not sure about, "as far as touch screen". if they are, I did not know that. I just saw the button to push to operate and more buttons to have different things play. they really love them, and for the price, I feel definitely worth the cost. TY.
customer_reviews.author: pleased customer

customer_reviews.title: There's better option of this toy mobile under Leap Frog
customer_reviews.text: This is good toy for toddler and the sturdiness is good, it fell on the floor tiles several times but it's still working and looks fine, unless you mean to break it though I guess it will break 😂 There's better option of this toy mobile under Leap Frog, that I would recommend you to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nasser

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun & educational product!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little phone! I got it for my sweet baby nephew for his 1st birthday. I’ve never seen one in person but after reading the reviews I decided to get it. It’s angoid size for a little hand and the buttons are easy to touch. The little dog sings and talks to you so that will be fun for a toddler. Plus, what toddler doesn’t love a phone??? I found this on Amazon Warehouse and the only thing “wrong” with it was 1 part of the box was slightly bent. No big deal!! Great, fun & educational toy!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Great little toy
customer_reviews.text: We don't buy a ton of electronic-type toys, but I got this to keep my 18 month old busy while he's on the changing table, and it works perfectly. It's the right size for him to hold pretty securely (though he has dropped it a few times on his face). He loves to push the buttons and its distracting enough to keep diaper changes from turning into a wrestling match. We also have the Leapfrog music player (for the same reason), but he prefers this one. I think it's easier for him to see the animations on the green-lit screen, and he likes the greater number of buttons. I find the animations and voices really cute, rather than annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my phone obsessed toddler
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is always pretending to be on the phone making phone calls, so I thought this would be really fun for him. This is an adorable little fun and maybe it'll help with his counting, but I'm pretty sure its mostly for fun. I like that the volume isn't too high and the sounds aren't too annoying.
customer_reviews.author: jennys

customer_reviews.title: Thick phone
customer_reviews.text: Quite thick and heavy. Purchased this for younger baby (younger than what is on the box) just so he could press buttons and hear noises... but he doesn't really show a ton of interest because it his heavy and thick and hard to pick up. Ended up buying another baby phone that he likes better. Probably better for older kids as it was designed.
customer_reviews.author: OptoLady

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought another as my three year old granddaughter wanted one, too (originally bought the first one for her one year old sister), despite her having two or three other fake phones. Guess the Leapfrog is more fun. The older one likes to use it to “call” the doctor, etc., during imaginary play. The younger one likes to push the buttons, etc.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Teachable talking!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is short and wide enabling little hands to grip well and easily maneuvered to ear. My son has no trouble holding the phone to ear while walking imitating me whenever I have to make a call or pretending to talk on phone. The colors are enticing and the buttons don’t have to be pressed hard to work. It teaches numbers, sings songs, etc. The volume control is pleasing and overall a great toy!
customer_reviews.author: SAHM Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Leapfrog has always been our go to brand for durable and educational kid products. However this I missed the mark. Although very cute, from the sounds, colors and lights it didn’t last very long and a few buttons stopped working in 2nd month. Can’t recommend this even though cute. For comparison older daughter (6) had a VTech phone when she was little and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to Learn Numbers
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 22 month old daughter and in the beginning she was just pressing the buttons. Now at almost 24 months she's been counting, singing along and pretending to have phone convos haha. I would encourage her to play with it by counting and singing with her as well. She plays with it pretty often!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not real enough to fool the baby yet a good toy
customer_reviews.text: We got this one because our 9-month-old has been particularly interested in our iPhone, yet she could tell the difference pretty quickly (though we pretended to use this one as our phone for a day or two to arouse her interest). She has treated it as another toy with sound and likes it. Maybe she will regard it as 'phone' when she grows a little older and knows what phone does.
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 days... and it was only played with a handful of times gently.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Franco

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my grandson and he loves it. He is a year old. He loved getting on the phone and talking so this is a great toy for him. Great sounds and lights up. Came with the batteries so I didn't have to worry about that so that was a plus! "This product was a personal purchase for myself at the normal retail/list price. I am reviewing it solely because I want to share my experience with other potential customers. I have received no compensation for my review nor do I have any relationship with the seller or manufacturer of this product."
customer_reviews.author: iheartteecee

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: My niece's son keeps taking her cell phone and randomly dialing numbers. He has called several of her coworkers and some strange man who was very understanding. Now he has his own phone and he has stopped taking her phone at least for now. She was very grateful for this toy. It works great and keeps her son occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Kelley

customer_reviews.title: One dip in the pool, and it's all over. lol
customer_reviews.text: My 3yo granddaughter loves her phone. So much so, that she discovered it doesn't mix well with the pool.🤦🏼‍♀️ So now we're on phone #2. lol
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toy Phone
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old son loves this phone. He was holding his toy remote up to his eye babbling into it so I figured, why not get him a proper toy phone. It holds his attention long enough. He enjoys pushing the different buttons. I like that it's not overwhelmingly loud when he holds it up to his eat. He hasn't figured out the volume switch yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Still works after being dumped in the bath!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1yr daughter because she loves taking our phones. SHE LOVES IT. We love all LeapFrog products, and this one's no exception. On top of entertaining her, she threw it in a full bath tub once, and after leaving it in a bag of rice overnight, it still worked!
customer_reviews.author: Borsalino A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect educational toddler gift!
customer_reviews.text: Better than the past toddler phones! Can't wait to give this as a gift, I think the toddler is going to love it. Has great songs and also perfect for learning numbers! Highly recommend for educational gifts!
customer_reviews.author: 2020J

customer_reviews.title: Best child smartphone toy
customer_reviews.text: One of our twin 18-month olds received this from Santa, and instantly was a toy to fight over between them. Before this, they would try to sneak out phones and remote controls. Don't get me wrong, they still do. But this phone quickly replaces those things, since they love it so much. They think they are interacting with the screen when they touch it, and each button causes the dog to do something different. We HAD to order another one to stop the fighting around here. Thankfully it's not very expensive and prime shipping had it arrive in 2 days!!
customer_reviews.author: MN Mom

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must-have for travel and car rides
customer_reviews.text: 300% value for the price. I think it's the little screen that makes kids love this toy because a tablet by LeapFrog didn't make such a blast. It's an absolute must have for travel because it's small and can busy a kid up for tens of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Elena A.

customer_reviews.title: Truly Enjoying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my newly 1 yr old grandson for his first birthday because he loves trying to play with other people's cell phones. From the moment it came out of the packaging, he loved it. He likes all the sounds and the speaking voice and tries to use it like a phone by placing it to his ear (or near it). Volume was fine, voice was clear, music was quick and easy to listen to. He dances to the music. Button size and overall size were perfect for his little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: My son is always trying to play with my phone so I decided to get him his own play phone for Christmas. I wasn’t expecting a whole lot for what I paid but it came in and I’m pleasantly surprised with the quality. I thought it was a simple light up toy but it’s actually educational. I’ve decided I’ll probably get this for all of my friend’s kid’s birthdays.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Yup!
customer_reviews.text: My kid likes it! Nowadays kids are obsessed with cell phone so having their own is a big thing to them.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: At least 5 minutes of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I have two toddlers, so toys that keep my kids entertained for at least five minutes can feel like a miracle. This "phone" does just that. We've had a few phone toys over the years, but this one is hands down the best, with enough options that both kids love playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Koivu

customer_reviews.title: Love this little phone!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this phone! It's a perfect size for little hands to handle. It's also the perfect size to keep in your purse, so you can keep it with you at all times and have a toy available to entertain kids in the car, in a stroller or even at dinner. The colors on the screen keep them interested and the music and sounds also keep them entertained. I love that this toy has a volume control and off switch. It makes it a good toy for on-the-go! My kids love the violet and scout leap frog characters so this toy is a big hit in our house!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price and gets delivered directly to my grandson's house
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this for my eight month old grandson so he can have his own since he's always grabbing everyone else's. It's been about 10 days since we gave it to him and he seems to like it and it seems to be durable so far
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Not what you hoping for....
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this product to become a favorite toy, based off reviews. That was not the outcome. It has Oregon trial like graphics, and very simple features, will not distract child from your phone as hoped.
customer_reviews.author: DHansbury

customer_reviews.title: Check it before giving it to a child.
customer_reviews.text: The 1, 5, & 9 buttons did not work. Very disappointing for the birthday boy.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Tinnin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Durable, tolerates frequent drops.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, so great for a toddler. My 18 month old granddaughter cannot turn on the switch. She loves playing with it though, it has different pics and sounds with each number, and she loves the music button.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: My son just turned 1 and I bought this when he was 10 months old. He likes it and smiles every time you push a button and Scout talks. It lights up, plays music (nursery rhymes), counts and more. He's now trying to copy the sounds and repeat what Scout says. A great toy. Ocassionally he still wants mommy and daddy's cell phones but if I tell him to go get his phone he will go looking for it, so its a great distraction. Holds up pretty well since he's dropped it several times on our hardwood floors and it still works. It also has 2 sound adjustment buttons as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 rating
customer_reviews.text: Gave the phone to 2 toddlers for gifts. One likes it and enjoys using it in the car. The other toddler wasn’t impressed. So 50/50 as to whether this was a good toy with learning, and fun for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LeapFrog definitely didn't disappoint with this product
customer_reviews.text: LeapFrog definitely didn't disappoint with this product. My two young kids have played with this a ton. After multiple drops, this phone stands strong. It definitely keeps kids entertained and also helps with teaching numbers. I also just bought one for another family member as well. I definitely recommend this product. LeapFrog seems to never disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: T.J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: No batteries needed that should say it all. This is a birthday gift for a two year old girl. I had to try the gift to see if it would work and needless to say it met all my expectations. Do not hesitate to purchase
customer_reviews.author: Senior lady

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his cell phone. Like all kids, he has become so captivated by our cell phones. He is 9 months, and I haven't been keen on just handing ours over, so we bought him this...and he seems very satisfied with it when we hand it to him.
customer_reviews.author: RachichiLu

customer_reviews.title: Not annoying
customer_reviews.text: Keeps a 9 month old fairly entertained, but more importantly distracts him from wanting my cell phone. Hopefully he'll play with it for awhile. Not annoying songs/noises, that's what was huge for me.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: The phone toy has a cute design, but it is not very interactive. I was expecting it to have more activities and games. Phone keypad is also very hard to press for a little child.
customer_reviews.author: Mihaela Copil

customer_reviews.title: A Good Toy
customer_reviews.text: This phone was for my one year old niece and she likes it. It distracts her for about five minutes and then she's off again. The sound is good and loud enough not to be too annoying. I think of all the other phones I was looking at during Christmas, this was the most sturdy one. The numbers are big enough, probably about half an inch or so in width, and easily pressed to light up the phone. Nothing less than what I would expect from LeapFrog.
customer_reviews.author: Not2Bother

customer_reviews.title: Cute, not nearly as annoying as most kid toys- intelligent time-out. win-win-win!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has a real screen that shows how many of something the puppy is counting or talking about. Kids can make the correlation between numbers and value. The only downside is that Violet, the dog that calls, apparently has an unlimited plan and is constantly calling. But she does cut it out after a few minutes without a response. And the phone doesn't just answer her calls- you have to push the answer button. My little one doesn't get that part yet, but that's fine by me. Mostly violet wants to ask to play and tell us how much she likes being our friends. I wish she'd get some other friends sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Bergonzi

customer_reviews.title: A good product, but not the miracle the reviews promised.
customer_reviews.text: Daughter already had 2 other toy phones. One she likes pretty good and one she didn't care for. This one seemed to have the best reviews and promises that if your baby didn't like any other phone they would LOVE this one. So I figured I would give it a go too. No real interest though. She liked it better than the wooden phone (that did nothing) but not more than the v-tech phone. I would give it 5 stars for quality, 4 for design, and 3 for actual interest.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Played it’s part for years
customer_reviews.text: My son had this phone for years and loved it! By the time I had to change the batteries he put grew it. It was beat up from being thrown and the usual kid play, but it never stopped. Now it’s our daughters turn to have one.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy-Allan Kaech

customer_reviews.title: Popular Gift
customer_reviews.text: LeapFrog Chat and Count Smart phones have become a go-to gift from me to the one-year olds in my life (even though its age group is stated as 18 months and up.) It seems that modern babies play with their parents' cell phones quite a bit and have an affinity for playing with their own at an earlier age than stated. The cheery music and little recorded voices are pleasing to hear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought a vtec at the same time....this one is the best. Better for younger kids ....maybe 3 or 4 year olds. Battery lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob or Brenda

customer_reviews.title: What kid doesn't want their own phone
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my 1 year old nephew. He loves to play with his mom's cell phone, and this was the perfect distraction from the real thing...don't want mom's phone getting broken. He dug through everything to get to it. The buttons are easy to push, and just loud enough to not be too obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Shyla S.

customer_reviews.title: So cute, so useful!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the perfect toy for my 2 year old who is obsessed with answering anything in reach as soon as a phone rings. It has helped him continue learning his numbers as well!
customer_reviews.author: patti tellez

customer_reviews.title: Big for a cell phone replacement, but super fun if you're super young
customer_reviews.text: This is the size of a mid-90's cell phone. It's very loud and comes with batteries, and so if you're looking for a benign plaything, this is great. If you're looking for something that will fool your kid into thinking it's youror, keep looking. Pros: +Kids love it +Kids will eat this instead of your cell phone +Hard to swallow, since it's so big +Comes with batteries +Will fool very small children Cons: -Won't completely fool kids since it's different ergonomically than regular cell phones have been for the past 10-15 years -Won't fool the kids that aren't very small -Louder than a regular cell phone
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dewey

customer_reviews.title: This is my son’s favorite toy! He’s 2 years 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my son’s favorite toy! He’s 2 years 6 months, I was a bit skeptical before I bought it thinking it would not be advanced enough for him and he would get bored with it soon. He loves it! Takes it everywhere he goes and even learnt the conept of counting and relate the number of items to a number. I’m very happy that i purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Pat W

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Better toy phones on the market.
customer_reviews.text: There's only the keypad to play with (no other buttons)and my 9 month old doesn't have enough pressure in their fingers to hit the numbers. The phone is very chubby which makes it hard to hold as well. The animation is alright. Neither kid could care less about it. They prefer the battat toy "hi phone " a lot more than this one and so do I. It has popular music tunes, a recording button, and is more interactive.
customer_reviews.author: T OB

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorites
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old daughter loves this toy phone! She was always trying to grab mine, so I had to find something for her. I've seen other toy phones that light up, but this one actually has a mini screen with graphics. Ex: she presses the 9 button and nine hats line up in the screen, counted out by "Violet." So, it's also a good learning tool for counting. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the 18 month old grandbaby
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest hit for my granddaughter. She loves this phone and has quit trying to take everyone else phone. She talks on it and pushes the buttons. She comes and shows us all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Koch

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: My boy used this for about 5 minutes and now doesn't even bother with it. Its boring and really does not keep a childs interest for long. I tried to get my nephews to play with it they are all around 2 and 3 years old with the same result. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter is going to LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: My dad got my son the green one for Christmas 2 years ago when he was a year old & he still plays with his, but now it's a fight bc his little sister has taken quite the interest in it as well. We knew we had to get her one of her own to hopefully stop the fighting so this will be the present from her brother. Ha. She is going to love it & especially bc she won't have to share it. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Simple and basic but she likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for 3 1/2 yr old. Her eyes lit up when she opened it. She enjoys a few minutes alone playing and talking to Scout, and then calling and talking to family....across the room. It's cute.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Friend

customer_reviews.title: Cute and educational!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year old for her birthday and it's her new favorite toy. It has cute sounds, (not too terribly annoying. 😜), and it teaches them their numbers in a fun way. No complaints with how it works, it seems super durable as well. We're very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: If you tolerate the sound well
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter loves this phone but the sound is annoying after a while. I would not give it as a gift unless you're certain of the parents' tolerance to constant noise. It can be too much after a while.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, my 2 year old son loves it :)
customer_reviews.text: Came in very early, couldn't wait to open it because I knew my son would be excited. When he opened it, he loved it lol. Wouldn't put it down for 20 mins straight and was holding conversations with Spot. I really like all the different options it has, counts to 10, has the cute animation, and teaches manners. The only thing is I wish the Spot would talk a little longer when you push the phone option to talk to him. He talks for a few seconds then hangs up. My son gets excited when Spot says hello but when he says bye my son puts the phone down because he thinks he left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work right out of the box. So disappointing. I waited too long to return it so I couldn't get my money back. Would not buy again. I put brand new batteries in it & it did not work. I was so excited to let my son play with it & then so upset when we realized it was a POS. 😒
customer_reviews.author: Rebeccah A.

customer_reviews.title: " The functionality is pretty good. LCD display is basic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 17 month son for Christmas. He LOVEs it, maybe even too much. He carries it around everywhere and if he leaves it somewhere you'll hear him looking for it "phone? phone?.." The functionality is pretty good. LCD display is basic, but functional, which probably helps make it sturdy. This has been dropped, thrown, kicked, etc and so far it held up (2 months). We're still on the first set of batteries, which is good. Press the buttons and there's both an audio response and video response.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Nokia must have made this phone cause it never breaks
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little phone. Nothing my kid does to it can break it. it has been dropped on concrete, covered in apple juice and throw across the room. it still keeps ticking. It is one of the few things my son constantly chooses to carry around with him and keeps him happy during long car rides.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: We’ll made. Sturdy. Great sound. I wish the ‘display’ screen was bigger, so little ones would be entertained with just the pictures. I was hoping we could turn off the sound (at church, etc) and still have it entertain. But is only entertaining with sound on.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Nice little toy
customer_reviews.text: The screen still lights up bright but the volume got very low pretty quick. My son seemed to really like it for the first few months and he still picks it up occasionally. I'd say it was worth it but nothing amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Cute little phone, keeps little fingers busy!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old was obsessed with my iPhone but would you believe he wasn't being gentle with it?! ;-) This little phone works as a great distraction! We have the stuffed Scout dog at home and he loves him...this thing is super cute as it counts with him and sings to him with Scout's voice. He presses the little buttons and it's wonderful for car rides that he would normally cry through. I'm considering purchasing another one so we can keep one is each car. Cute, would recommend, keeps the little guy entertained. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Good quality toy. My 1YO likes it
customer_reviews.text: My 1yo daughter likes it. Sturdy and kid friendly. No sharp edges , however it's bit heavy as per my opinion. It's good option than having to show your kid actual mobile phones. Keeps little one enterntained and helps to introduce counting :)
customer_reviews.author: Trup

customer_reviews.title: Cute little toy
customer_reviews.text: Adorable little “cell phone” toy. My 15 month old just loves it. Was disappointed however to see that the pink one was more expensive simply because of the color, so even though I wanted to get the pink/violet one we got the blue/green one instead. They should have been the same price regardless of color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Fun Make-Believe Toy
customer_reviews.text: My grand-daughter LOVES "her cell," as she pretends to be like mommy and daddy. This is a fun toy to take along on trips or to the store because it keeps her entertained so well. My son (her father) plays along with her as well -- its just sooo darn cute!
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: He has really liked having his own "phone" and I love that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 month old is always grabbing for our phones, so we purchased this LeapFrog one for him. He has really liked having his own "phone" and I love that it counts aloud when he pushes the numbers. It also rings and plays a couple songs.
customer_reviews.author: HanksMamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Overall, the best baby "phone" available!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Speaks clearly with good educational activities Very much like a real phone Baby can press the buttons easily Cute graphics, but simple It will be a while before this can be used as a learning tool for my little guy (14 months), but it has potential to be a good educational toy for counting Cons: Didn't keep his interest too long, but that is a 14-month old for you. Somewhat limited on what activities it can do Loudest volume setting is VERY loud, but this isn't necessarily a con overall
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn S. McGlothlin

customer_reviews.title: Two puppy biscuits!
customer_reviews.text: Two puppy biscuits! My daughter loves this phone AND I think it's hilarious too. Puppy biscuits? Something about the energetic and upbeat renaming of "dog treats" has me in stitches every time I hear it! We have a lot of handmade wooden toys in our house. This is the one china made piece of plastic that actually seems worth it to us! (She's only one. My time of plastic infiltration will come, I'm sure.) I also think it is teaching her numbers.... not the Montessori way, but who cares? Two puppy biscuits!
customer_reviews.author: Dmarr Esolomon

customer_reviews.title: Nice play phone
customer_reviews.text: My toddler enjoys using this phone. Not a perfect substitution for a real phone, but it occupies him enough to keep him from trying to steal mine all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N. Spritzer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.text: I several of these for the children in the family. They LOVE them, and do the parents! Great for keeping the kids occupied in the car, or just around the house. It resembles a smartphone, but they are learning as they are mimicking you on your phone, which is great. Glad I bought these for sure, and it is wonderful seeing the little ones playing with them so much. The worst thing about buying gifts for babies is never seeing them get use out of it, and that is not the case with this.
customer_reviews.author: Colin J

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for 2 year olds who love to handle cell phones. Kept them very entertained. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DAN SCHULTZ

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old approved
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think my daughter would take much interest in this being that she’s used to our touch screen technology but she’s only one so I don’t want to get her anything like that yet she actually loves this though keeps her busy in the car which is where I usually keep it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a touchscreen but keeps her busy
customer_reviews.text: We love this phone. It keeps our daughter occupied and busy enough to forget about wanting to play with our phones. Warning to all millennial parents: this is not a touch screen phone. You actually have to push the buttons circa early 2000 phones.
customer_reviews.author: Watsontime

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old granddaughter LOVES it! It was the hit of the birthday party. All the cousins wanted to play with it, but she wouldn't let it out of her grasp. Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Carlino

customer_reviews.title: Great play phone!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Have had a few different kinds of play phones, but these are the kids’ favorites by far! Plus they have some counting games that will come in useful.
customer_reviews.author: C Badge

customer_reviews.title: Let's call Scout!
customer_reviews.text: I love Scout and this is the same cute little voice. My son is 14 months and really doens't know numbers, but I'm hoping that by him playing with this he will hear the repititon. Scout counts along, i.e. 4 puppy biscuits. Really adorable. I bought this at the same time as the LeapFrong Grove Music Player and I think he likes that one slightly better, only because it plays songs. But he likes pushing buttons and he now puts this up to his ear. You can't really go wrong with either one of these toys, and for the price, I recommend both.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Leap Frog Smart phone toy
customer_reviews.text: Got for my grand dgtrs 1st Birthday. She LOVES playing make believe and the sounds it makes entertains her for extended periods of time. An added plus that it is teaching her to count and identify her colors. Item as described, quick delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Cute and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Our 17 month old loves this phone. He is totally drawn to our Smartphones, but this one seems to entertain him pretty well also. He was given two of them (on accident) so we keep one in the car and one in the house. For car rides he really enjoys it and I see him kissing the picture of Scout when he sees him. (he has a Scout stuffed animal too) Its a pretty cute little phone. Also, its holding up well to being tossed around.
customer_reviews.author: Hakkattack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. The screen is hard to see and volume is limited. It gets thrown aside for other toys. Buttons are hard to push for little fingers
customer_reviews.author: Jill myers

customer_reviews.title: They could do better to make this more realistic for $15 I expect better
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap. Not worth the 15 bucks that I paid
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: They won't put it down!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1 yr old, but by 3rd old loves it so much she hides it. She played with this for an hour straight! Very cute, easy to hold for both kids and easy buttons. The graphic is a little old school and could be better, but the kids don't care. I may need to buy another it is so popular. ***THREE YEARS LATER: This thing is still kicking around and my youngest still plays with it and "calls grandma". Long lasting battery. It has held up to all sorts of abuse!
customer_reviews.author: H. CONDIE

product_meta.title: LeapFrog Chat and Count Smart Phone, Scout
product_meta.description: Color:GreenFun learning in a smart little phone! Sing along to songs about counting and phone routines, explore more than 15phone activities and call on Scout for learning fun as you trade calls and voicemails with your puppy pal! Parents can connect to the online LeapFrog Learning Path for customized learning insights and ideas to expand the learning.Appropriate for children ages 18 months and up. Fun learning in a smart little phone! Appropriate for children ages 18 months and up. Push the music button and sing along to songs about counting and phone routines. Push the call button to trade calls and voicemails with your puppy pal Scout! Press any of the 10 number buttons to see an animated Scout count it out in a fun way, then explore more than 15 fun phone activities! Parents can connect to the online LeapFrog Learning Path for customized learning ideas and insights from LeapFrog.
feature_bullets: Fun learning in a smart little phone! Sing along to songs about counting, explore more than 15 phone activities, and more! Appropriate for ages 18 months and up.
Explore more than 15 phone activities as you pretend and play with your very own smart phone! Push the call button to trade calls and voicemails with your puppy pal Scout/Violet!
Push the music button and sing along to songs about counting, phone manners, and more. Press any of the 10 number buttons to see an animated Scout/Violet count it out in a fun way.
Fun animations and a counting song introduce numbers and counting 1 to 10, while more than 15 phone activities encourage imaginative play.
Skills learned inlucde numbers, pretend play, and social skills. Children also learn conversational skills such as saying hello, how are you, nice to talk to you, and goodbye.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,363 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
